title: Mud, sweat and gears: 75 years of Britain's renowned World Rally Championship round
text:
What does Wales Rally GB – which starts today and runs until Sunday – have in common with Fawlty Towers? Seriously. It’s a genuine question. Britain’s 75-year-old round of the World Rally Championship really does share something quite significant with some of John Cleese’s finest work.

The answer? Torquay. You didn’t see that one coming, did you?

It’s true though: the inaugural Royal Automobile Club Rally finished in Torquay in 1932. Thirty-nine years later, Fawlty Towers started in the same town when Cleese and co. were there filming the Flying Circus.
